content: Given the following mathematical function expressions, you need to calculate the indefinite integral of the function (excluding the constant C), then substitute 'x=4' into the result of the indefinite integral, and finally provide me with the integer result of the expression by rounding down. (The answer should consist of only a single integer number representing the final result, with no additional words.)

The indefinite integral of the function ln((1+x)) with respect to x is:

ln(1+x) + C, where C is the constant of integration.

要求解 $\ln(1+x)$ 的不定积分。

首先，我们使用分部积分法来求解这个积分。设 $u = \ln(1+x)$，$dv = dx$。

根据分部积分公式：
$$\int u \, dv = uv - \int v \, du$$

我们需要计算 $du$ 和 $v$：
$$u = \ln(1+x) \implies du = \frac{1}{1+x} \, dx$$
$$dv = dx \implies v = x$$

将这些代入分部积分公式中：
$$\int \ln(1+x) \, dx = x \ln(1+x) - \int \frac{x}{1+x} \, dx$$

接下来，我们简化 $\int \frac{x}{1+x} \, dx$：
$$\int \frac{x}{1+x} \, dx = \int \left(1 - \frac{1}{1+x}\right) \, dx = \int 1 \, dx - \int \frac{1}{1+x} \, dx$$

这两个积分分别是：
$$\int 1 \, dx = x$$
$$\int \frac{1}{1+x} \, dx = \ln|1+x|$$

因此：
$$\int \frac{x}{1+x} \, dx = x - \ln|1+x| + C$$

将这个结果代回到原积分中：
$$\int \ln(1+x) \, dx = x \ln(1+x) - (x - \ln|1+x|) + C$$

简化后得到：
$$\int \ln(1+x) \, dx = x \ln(1+x) - x + \ln|1+x| + C$$

所以，$\ln(1+x)$ 的不定积分为：
$$\boxed{\int \ln(1+x) \, dx = x \ln(1+x) - x + \ln|1+x| + C}$$
